text: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Energy and persistence conquer all things.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Lost time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Our life is frittered away by detail; simplify, simplify.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: It is not length of life, but depth of life.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear, not absence of it.
author: Mark Twain

text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

text: He who is brave is free.
author: Seneca

text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
author: Seneca

text: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: You have power over your mindâ€”not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus

text: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
author: Epictetus

text: Men are disturbed not by things, but by the views which they take of them.
author: Epictetus

text: Fortune favors the bold.
author: Virgil

text: Take rest; a field that has rested gives a bountiful crop.
author: Ovid

text: Habits change into character.
author: Ovid

text: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
author: Cicero

text: More is lost by indecision than wrong decision.
author: Cicero

text: The greater the difficulty, the greater the glory in surmounting it.
author: Epicurus

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
author: Cicero

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
author: (Often attributed; use with caution)

text: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: (Often attributed; use with caution)

text: To thine own self be true.
author: William Shakespeare

text: There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Action is eloquence.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Boldness be my friend.
author: William Shakespeare

text: The better part of valor is discretion.
author: William Shakespeare

text: To be, or not to be: that is the question.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Genius is eternal patience.
author: Michelangelo

text: To be prepared is half the victory.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

text: Diligence is the mother of good fortune.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

text: Do not squander time, for that is the stuff life is made of.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: (Often attributed; use with caution)

text: What we think, we become.
author: Buddha

text: All that we are is the result of what we have thought.
author: Buddha

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

text: When anger rises, think of the consequences.
author: Confucius

text: As a man thinketh in his heart, so is he.
author: Proverbs (KJV)

text: Be strong and of a good courage.
author: Joshua (KJV)

text: A soft answer turneth away wrath.
author: Proverbs (KJV)

text: Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.
author: Peter Marshall

text: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
author: Plato

text: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: (Often attributed; use with caution)

text: When one is at peace within, one is at peace with the world.
author: (Proverb)

text: Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: Hope is a waking dream.
author: Aristotle

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are small matters compared to what lies within us.
author: (Often attributed; use with caution)

text: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
author: Thomas Paine

text: He who would accomplish little must sacrifice little; he who would achieve much must sacrifice much.
author: James Allen

text: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
author: Vince Lombardi (use with caution if quoting commercially)
